result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Garrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael James Garrick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael James Garrick was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today June 24, 2015.
Probation may be transferred to Ramsey County MN.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF82.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF82.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L. Hahn, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael James Garrick appeared.  Court called at 9:07 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Attorney Andrea recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty    to the amended Ct 1 with the repeater stripped.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of the amended Ct 1 with the repeater stripped. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 2 years probation with conditions
- AODA with follow through with any recommended treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250 for the DNA Surcharge
- DE can pay court costs through the DOC
- DE to sign up for probation 06/24/2015
- Probation can be transferred to Ramsey County
- Bail is continued until the DE signs up for probation
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.

***AMENDED***

-Bond is to be Co-Signed by Mary Skweres 

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Christopher K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

-Defendant to remain with his mother at all times and not leave the residence without his mother or father present (House Arrest).


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Michael James Garrick appeared.  Court called at 11:05 a.m.  Attorney Andrea advises the court there is no agreement and asking to continue the PTC.  ADA Hahn requests a modification of the bond to include a no contact.  Court grants modification.  Court adjourned.  lw  Court adjourned at 11:09 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Amended. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael James Garrick appeared.  Court called at 4:24 p.m.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE Pleads No Guilty on all counts.  DE is waiving a speedy trial.  Set out for PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 4:26 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Michael James Garrick appeared.  Court called 9:16 a.m Set for Preliminary Hearing.  DE is waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviews with the DE his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.   DE applied to Teen Challenge and has been accepted. Bail is continued.  Set out for arraignment.  Court adjourned at 9:21 a.m.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Appointing Atty Andrea. km
